goal:
(1) To advance education and research by promoting the understanding and use of impact measurement tools, in particular 'Social Return on Investment', as a way of demonstrating social, environmental and economic added value.
(2) To organise, facilitate and develop a network of impact measurement practitioners specialising in the 'Social Return on Investment' methodology.
(3) To promote, develop and implement 'Social Return on Investment' methodology within a wide range of public, private and voluntary sector agencies, with a view to encouraging dissemination and use of the methodology.
(4) To offer training in the 'Social Return on Investment' methods and other impact methods as appropriate.
(5) To promote the commercial interests of the members of the Company by such means as the Directors may consider appropriate from time to time (which may include advertising their services) and irrespective of whether any steps taken to promote the commercial interests of members further the objectives set out in paragraphs (1) to (4) ABOVE.
interests: Budget, Economic and Financial Affairs, Enterprise, General and Institutional Affairs, Regional Policy
